column1: the first playthrough of elden ring is one of the best eperiences gaming can offer you but after youve explored everything in the open world and you ve experienced all of the surprises you lose motivation to go exploring on repeat playthroughs which takes lot away from the replayability which is very important thing for from games imo

a replay solidified my love for elden ring so easily my favorite game of all time actually beating malenia this time was also an amazing feeling just love being in this world man its the greatest of all time

incredible art banger soundtrack surprisingly charming storyline and big red dog hades has very smooth gameplay but after playing it for while it just feels like youre doing the same 3 hit combo ove and over again which dont get me wrong that combo feels great to do but once becomes muscle memory you kinda go into autopilot also think the boons are cool but would like to see them change the flow of combat bit more there are some cool ones like the grape boon that can change the way you play but most of them are just upgrades that dont really change the gameplay or strategy other then those 2 small gripes the game is fantastic

não sou muito de jogo indie admito que joguei poucos mas devo dizer que hades foi um dos melhores jogos que joguei na vida facilmente no top 15 toda sua arte dublagem gameplay carisma dos personagens é tudo incrivel

i can shake the feeling that am thoroughly bored playing hades ve picked up hades three times over the last few years and three times ve found myself putting down the controller after handful of hours especially after reaching the third stage and couldn figure out why it wasn working for me after giving it few good goes ve finally managed to pin down what it is that just doesn click for me about hades

em meio tanto jogo de mundo aberto ruim saindo por aí na última década acho que da pra entender porque breath of the wild chocou tanto as pessoas no ano em que ele lançou realmente eu acho que é melhor mundo aberto que eu já joguei até hoje explorar cada pedacinho desse mundo é tão gostoso parece que tudo aqui tá no mapa tem um propósito para estar lá diferente dos mapas vazios da ubisoft por exemplo acho que unico defeito é esses sistema chatinho de durabilidade das armas ficar trocando de arma tempo todo é tão chato espero que no próximo não tenha

for each individual aspect platforming exploration combat but the integration and packaging of the content are so good it slightly better that the sum of its parts most of the combat and traversal abilities feel useful and many evoke that super metroid gleeful feeling that you ll finally be able to access that new area grab that item or beat that boss the end game challenges reminiscent of wiley fortress and boss rushes after megaman has fully self actualized were the highlight boss rushes in particular were fun to dissect and master found uses for some charms had written off as not my style to counter some of the unconventional boss mechanics my only gripes n the repeated backtracking get it fast travel mechanic that too liberal can erase the environment but this was excessive n some of the charms seemed worthless even after strategizing for boss combat and platforming rushes n in the name of decency and civility make geo sucking ability automatic

nier automata is an unforgettable game androids vs machines all while trying to save humanity and uncover the cold truth of this post apocalyptic world 2b and 9s share common goal but have differing views through the story the combat is more fleshed out than its predecessor due to chips and pod mechanics characters change and face reality after meeting characters and concepts never seen before

this is my favorite game ever and the only game cared enough about to get the platinum trophy in might be biased here but the game has lot of things loved going in like the post apocalyptic setting the game isn perfect and while things like the 9s hacking and route pushed lot of people away still thoroughly enjoyed it getting ending and the final shut em up section in the credits ending with me giving up my save file to protect fellow player is one of the most beautiful moments ve seen in fiction as whole

the more mature story by recent pokémon standards lore ramifications for sinnoh and the amazing real time catch mechanics make this game one of the best pokémon games ever easily though good pokémon is still far from being good video game generally speaking the textures are muddy the levels especially alabaster icelands and cobalt coastlands feel janky and overly linear despite the game encouraging more mobile movement and freedom and of course the lack of meaningful presentation through stiff character animations and lack of voice acting hurt this game alot still feel like pokémon gameplay has peaked here but they just don let these games cook long enough and only get away with it because pokémon fans only play pokémon and don branch out to know what actually good

hmmmmmmm kind of divisive one here for me personally while liked the characters the plot felt kind of lacking and the connections to the other games in the series that were so hyped up by nintendo in marketing really didn add to much if anything you could have replaced the references to the previous games with original stuff and nothing substantial would be different in that aspect this game was really disappointing the villains were also an absolute joke with the mobius guys being the most generically boring guys in history and being immensely less cool the more you learn about him in terms of the gameplay though it was certainly fun the class system makes combat very customizable and feel its absolutely possible to sink your teeth really into managing your party to get the most out of all your options also did lot of side content in this game which is uncharacteristic of me as beelined it through the first two games exploration of the worlds is always fun in xenoblade games and this is no exception perhaps am just getting tired of the series but this definitely didn hit as much as the first or even the second game to me still would suggest to anyone that enjoyed the first two games because the gameplay is still fun but like yeaaaahh

incredible jump to 3d for the kirby games while still managing to feel like classic kirby title the game makes amazing use of 3d environments to add new layer of exploration and creativity to every single level and had lot of fun clearing the main and extra stories with all bonus challenges while the main content is easy and very chill bonus optional content can be very tricky only thing disliked were few difficulty spikes in some side objectives and the lack of restart from checkpoint button but overall this is masterful game that makes the most out of its simplicity as kirby game but this time you can swallow whole car and spit it unharmed

kirby and the ermmmmm goat n if future kirby games are like this totally wouldn mind that the gameplay is quite honestly an upgrade to the original formula the bosses quite specifically are the most fun fights ve had in quite while great stuff right here
perhaps the best kirby game since 64 and roboplanet with great ability upgrades inventive levels great bosses and of course thick layer of cute smothered all over every aspect

replayed with the kids the later levels and the treasure road portals make great use of every power the hidden waddle dees push you to explore sure but also demand perfection for few bosses and the forgotten islands prove the developers knew exactly what they were doing few enemies get additional move sets that expertly increase the pressure if anything wanted dodge move to help me out some more n kept easy on the entire play through and barely scraped by the back part of the game yet it always changing enemy and levels up enough that it never feels repetitive if anything was left wanting just taste more n overall great kirby game and great video game

i ve had bit of troubled history with cuphead before now ve tried it on two different occasions both with varying results my first attempt ended pretty swiftly since didn have controller and the keyboard controls are really bad the game didn quite jive with me at that point but my main problem at that point was the hell that is cuphead with keyboard controls year or two later would play through the whole game and later the dlc in co op with friend we did this over steam so there was bit of lag but had controller and friend to help me through enjoyed the game lot more to the point where was the one pushing us to do the dlc together but it still didn quite enamour me like d wanted it to my main complaint at the time was the design of some of the bosses felt that lot of them relied on being able to pay attention to cues and bullets coming from multiple parts of the screen often with them all acting completely independently have huge amount of trouble processing all of that information so oftentimes found bosses just far too overwhelming not design issue or anything more of personal one

the most engaging puzzles riddles ive ever seen in game solutions are very clever but not unfair exploring the planets and their ruins and stumbling on all kinds of crazy shit is great time and unraveling the mystery one step at time so you can piece together the bigger picture is incredibly satisfying the environment design is also amazing and the concepts in the later portions of the game are so cool and interesting cant elaborate because of spoilers the dlc is just okay though ngl exploring the setting was cool but it felt like lot of running around doing busy work for very little reward

fantastic game from start to finish the curiosity and confusion in the beginning before you experience and realize the loop for the first time is breath of fresh air not much direction just some input from npcs about space mission and before you know it you are uncovering secrets of fallen race and the death of the universe the experience is underlined with fantastic score and the design of the puzzles is great it a bit tiresome when you get stuck and feel like you re just too dense to progress but when things fall in place and do make sense it fantastic when you finally piece everything together know exactly what you need to do and where is an undescribeable feeling this is very much as close as you can get to perfect game

hate to be hater but man did hate this may as well lean into it by far one of the least pleasurable and enjoyable experiences ve ever had with video game in any capacity with anything really spread out and torturous over 30 aching hours determined to finish this and think it counts for something this is my first experience with final fantasy so can say how entirely faithful it is to the original know the big plot beats but like really this is the story that hit for so many people even in the differences this remake brings n really do just have too much to say about this and don really know where to begin about it all for the positives this is obviously incredible looking and uhhh yeah really like barrett but other than that it a struggle this thing really is emblematic of so many issues have with lot of gaming in general so self serious with huge misses when attempting anything light refuse to believe there are honest to god wedge stans out there giving us so many cinematics having the gameplay consist of another 5 or so steps along corridor and bam here another cutscene dialogue and vocal direction sucks cloud is an absolute black hole of charisma nobody is fun to play as except for barrett who has the most simple combat systems out of the 4 options

tunic is wonderful 2d zelda like that feels like love letter to the genre between an extremely charming aesthetic fun and interesting items and being extremely packed with puzzles and mystery it would be hard not to recommend this game to any fan of the genre the inclusions of things like made up language and the instruction booklet all work to great effect to simulate that feeling you had when you were kid trying to play game like link awakening discovery is always well rewarded and always feel earned by the player feel as though there are very few handouts in terms of progression through the game so even just simply navigating the world feels meaningful and accomplishing level design is top notch in this game and love all the secrets and hidden paths they provide using the game isometric view think the weakest parts of this game compared to its contemporaries is the mood of the game

truly one of the greatest visual novels ever released if not the best it has memorable lively unique and lovable cast of characters though miles edgeworth is obviously the one who shines the most which is not something we usually encounter in visual novel the cases gradually got better and better and the last case was literal masterpiece the fourth case was my favorite though since the character development in this is just so heartwarming the dialogue in this game never ever bored me did not skip one dialogue in this game and this is the first time this happened to me in visual novel everything is just so well written the story is always exciting and makes you curious about what will happen in the next testimony and you also always wonder how the things will turn out while investigating the soundtrack and the character sprites are also very well done and both of these play big role in this game charm n to summarize all of the written above phoenix wright ace attorney has the most fun you can have in visual novel and is overall phenomenal video game

this is collection of bunch of vignettes that all play with jrpg tropes in unique ways and for the most part found these stories really unique and entertaining this feels like the predecessor to chrono trigger in many ways so fans of that game will immediately see similarities it mostly very accessible game but my one big fault is that the game lets you choose any of these chapters to start with certain chapters enjoyed within the context of the rest of the game but are particularly unconventional and could make for very weak first impression aside from that tho honestly loved this combat is big standout for me each encounter was like mini tactics battle with really fun grid system had to thoughtfully consider how to dispatch enemies effectively and while it far from difficult game each battle had me engaged presentation is gorgeous with the hd 2d switch remake it a total overhaul that still remains faithful to the original while some chapters are definitely weaker than others thoroughly enjoyed the majority of my time with this game and while won spoil the final segments that come after you finish the seven main chapters found them to be so fun and satisfying that they elevate the entire experience this definitely deserves to be considered classic of the era right alongside ffvi and chrono trigger

such creative and imaginative rpg from start to finish that d honestly place it among my favorites the amount of love pumped into this remake is brimming and hard to not smile at the battle system was fun to get ahold of and the characters were all charming to see regardless of how simple they may come off as to people it was bit of blueprint for omnibus storytelling after all

i really enjoyed this one the story is super interesting most characters are multi layered and more complex than they initially seem and how this game handles skills and thoughts is genius as most reviews for this game have said it really great that failing skill check does not necessarily mean you re now going through worse version of the game in some cases it even more fun route the politics and wordbuilding are also super deep and will really please those who enjoy those topics in their media personally found myself more engrossed by the game study of the main character who was as awful and destructive as he was likeable and relatable also found it incredible how the writers have managed to give him his own personality while also allowing huge amount of his character to be determined by the player normally games tend to present one of these two archetypes for their main character but this mixture of both helps lot in giving the player much deeper connection with the character while also allowing the character to serve the main themes of the story n on that note the amount of choices they give you for customizing him are insane and they really don feel overwhelming despite there being multiple methods to change your character once again this contributes heavily into making the player fit into the role playing aspect of this game more as their choices contribute to the type of cop they want to be

a plague tale é uma aventura sobre dois irmãos durante período da peste jogo segue base do estilo narrativo com uma gameplay simples porém funcional dando foco principalmente em sua história comentando brevemente sobre jogabilidade plague tale não possui mecânicas refinadas ou grandes listas de habilidades diversas jogo resolve usar uma abordagem mais simples com apenas uma arma alguns tipos de munições que em suma maioria é utilizada de maneira pontual ao decorrer da jogatina gameplay simples relativamente repetitiva não é um problema aqui visto que jogo possui um enredo rico em detalhes que consegue desenvolver sua premissa com perfeição em um misto de momentos de ação angústia nervosismo fúria obra consegue entregar aquilo que promete muito mais conseguindo explicar os pontos que foram propostos serem explicados ao mesmo tempo que deixa pontas soltas para sua sequência plague tale requiem

artistically love this game the island setting is really refreshing and koholint is so lovely to just exist in the dreamlike nature of the narrative is super different for zelda and the way it all wraps up at the end is so nice finally meeting the wind fish waking up hearing marin song beautiful and the visual style oh my god adore how this game looks so much want every game to look like this it is so so full of charm and colour and personality give me mario game that looks like this give me pokemon game that looks like this give me fuckin gta game that looks like this genuinely what would love more than anything else in the world is for the zelda series after tears of the kingdom to come back to this style for the next mainline game don just keep this relegated to remakes if you do oracle of seasons ages give me full on original top down open world game with this visual style drop me in place as beautiful and mysterious as koholint tell me very little and let me discover it all on my own

in this first game the story and switching between present day circa 2007 and the past set in the crusade era holy land is such an intriguing premise and the authenticity of the world and character design can be admired that isn to say the game is the worst thing ever but it truly is soooooooo tedious and repetitive that it tough to recommend the parkour system is very cool and has lot of attention to detail put into the running and climbing animations scaling towers and doing leaps of faiths is so fun which somewhat makes up for the overabundance of sync points there are many other menial side missions that while not lacking in variety are just copy and pasted everywhere and it gets tiring very quickly play it if you re curious as some of the stealth is fun and little more low key compared to later entires in the series but don be surprised if it gets dull very quickly

sinceramente eu não curti sei que é primeiro jogo que as mecânicas ainda eram um rascunho mas caramba é torturante escalar combate não tem diversidade nenhuma o protagonista apesar de interessante não tem quase nada de carisma sempre falando em tom neutro sem expressar emoção n para um início mesmo levando em conta as limitações ainda é bem fraco é só ver que prince of persia fez mecânicas muito mais agradáveis que este deveria ser uma evolução pelo menos das escaladas mas não é que acontece basicamente jogo não tem stealth isso matou graça de muitas missões pois você basicamente chega no inimigo esfaqueia depois aperta botão para disfarçar me vi muitas vezes frustrado por ter de fazer missões repetitivas de assassinato onde tinham 3 alvos se eu falhasse ficava mais difícil porque os corpos dos que eu matei ainda estavam lá os guardas ficavam em alerta dificultando conseguir assassinar alvo sem falhar as vezes os npcs os loucos simplesmente me empurravam eu esbarrava em um guardsne falhava missão eu tive 0 vontade de fazer qualquer side quest que não fosse obrigado fazer para seguir com as principais que são todas praticamente iguais nada recompensadoras

ghost trick é facilmente um dos melhores jogos de ds não bastando sua gameplay única diversificada com touch cada puzzle é único sua narrativa contextualiza de forma genial suas ghost tricks seu cast principal é perfeito não só tem uma construção boa pro seu propósito como transmitem vida com ajuda das animações fabulosas até mesmo extravagantes que tornam satisfatório cada momento que você não está no controle ouso dizer ainda que ign está errada linearidade da obra torna crível funcional no meio de tudo que engloba não é um defeito n trilha sonora arrebenta composições extremamente boas para seus momentos efeitos sonoros de alta qualidade n texto é muito bom sabendo que nenhuma explicação seria boa suficiente foca na sua temática de morte arrependimento destino causa consequência ao invés de se demorar com origem do seu poder ainda sim sua explicação é aceitável se torna um bom recurso de roteiro até que se prove contrário é passível de não ter furos de roteiro ou pontas soltas sendo gratificante cada mistério resolvido inserido construção para grand finale não poderia ser melhor

a rare game that seamlessly melds the core game mechanic into rich world built on layers of narrative and some killer art and sound spend 5 minutes on n the eye n and it ll feel like you ve lived your whole sleeper life there spend 1 hour on n the eye n and for all it rusted containers failing life support and crushing spiraling n existence n you ll want to call it home

with art by guillaume singelin and music and sound design by amos roddy gareth damian martin n citizen sleeper n is genuinely gorgeous and rich game that gently reminds you that staying still is not always the best option even if you manage to pull yourself or get pulled into better place it also gently compels you to think about those moments in your life where sacrifices or compromises had to be made and how the choice to make them wasn always voluntary n nor was it always yours to make in the first place

i find myself in the odd position of struggling to write about n deus ex n the game felt longer than it actually was engrossing in way haven really experienced d consider myself good fan of immersive sims and it isn hard to see why this is considered as essential as it is n n deus ex n is by far the most accessible of its peers where games like n system shock 2 n or n vampire the masquerade bloodlines n had great diversity in buildcrafting and emergent gameplay there was always an almost cruel sense that there was specific comically unspecified character that large chunk of the games were designed for perhaps the absence of this ill balancing alone is what made n deus ex n more popular than its contemporaries but such an assessment perhaps fails to do justice to the feats of design that elevates it so much higher n n deus ex n doesn have even close to the same sense of aesthetics of other role playing games of its era rather unremarkable soundtrack with no astounding moments of art direction to really speak of there is great detail in its real estate but other than that one could not find the common constituents of game atmosphere to draw in through naturalistic ways so why then is n deus ex n so deeply immersive dynamism never before has world felt as reactive as this there is only one true instance where the world is not completely open ended to you where the game of the year version has made progressing to the level 2 labs of versalife impossible to do before returning to tong other than that every area puts the ball in your court if you can dream up solution chances are it can be done npcs objectives access to areas all remains seamless and alters accordingly pick up key before talking to an npc who tells you to go get it its not just that denton will be quick to mention this its the fact that you could potentially just walk past the npc entirely and get the move on there no disconnect in decision making you ll feel connected to denton the way you should playing game like this

here a pressing question for all you gamers under the age of thirty do you actively avoid playing games from the pre 3d era because of their lack of availability or because their foundation is comparatively primitive and therefore jarringly inaccessible the reason can be because these games are locked in an archival vault for they are commonly ported to modern platforms it must be due to the prevailing notion that video games have an arbitrary expiration date mon fess up m not saying everyone born after the early 90s shares these predilections but there seems to be widespread viewpoint among younger gamers that vilifies games that predate their own conception especially those of the early pixelated 2d period released before the late 1990s sneering distaste for the classics isn as pervasive with films or music zoomers will attend theater screenings of 2001 space odyssey high as kite and emphatically detail their transcendental experience to their peers with pulp fiction poster in the background of their dorm rooms no one is delusional enough to place the prequels or disney star wars films over the immortal original trilogy regardless of their age maybe it because spend too much time on the internet but ve noticed that discovering older music artists via the world wide web is more common practice among teenagers now than it was when was in high school older video games on the other hand are treated with the same reaction of revulsion as if they were being forced to eat their brussels sprouts admittedly as someone born in the early 3d era many of the industry practices and comparatively primitive facets of game design can verge on being excruciating can count merely handful of games that were released before was born that are among my personal favorites as there is only so much pain can handle before my spirit shatters and am in dire need of relaxing bath with some chocolate ice cream for comfort conversely there are plenty of those whose gaming prime was this jagged era and the shift to 3d left them bewildered they ve assigned themselves to the role of gaming elder statesmen whose repertoire is cryogenically frozen to the time before the medium became polygonal after certain point where the gaming industry reached point of proficiency with 3d visuals to an almost cinematic extent games that resembled those of the primeval pixelated years started popping out of the indie woodwork one of the first breakout titles in this new wave of old school revival games was shovel knight 2d side scroller that arguably bridged the generational gap of gamers

yume nikki is one of those games often point to in conversation with fellow designers as shining example of how well video game can capture specific person experience these types of rpg maker horror games usually get bad rap they are often cheap products made by inexperienced designers who believe that mashing teenage girl protagonists with horrific set pieces will instantly make work profound yume nikki does not deserve to be lumped in with the contemporaries kikiyama the developer managed to extract clever narrative meaning within the bounds of rpg maker limited toolset in way that left me genuinely floored this game is best approached completely blind so will refrain from saying any details but it has transformed the way approach experiential design even if the games want to make look nothing like this

max payne is such good game with some crippling problems that really date it the voice acting is top tier and james mccaffrey is the biggest reason for this success and is one of the best voice actors ever the gameplay is unqiue and so satisfying diving through the air as the world explodes around you and bullets whiz past you the depiction of new york as this grim snowy crime ridden land fits so well with the place and the cheesiness makes this so good but played this on the pc port and the game crippling issues with the difficulty slider got annoying really quick walking through door and getting insta headshot three times and then the fourth time doing the same thing and not having it happen got annoying and supposedly there is major bug that makes it so the difficulty slider which is tied to the only difficulty you can play at the start is broken and doesn properly balance the game as well some aspects feel little too gamey in this serious tale with few levels sticking out like sore thumb the underground level feel enemy variety wasn really thing just the same enemy that got stronger and stronger but overall this is very good game with aspects that haven ever really been replicated as well which is shame we need more top tier slow mo shooters

initially awesome open world exploration game that suffers from overambition but still provides worthwhile journey n intriguing fantasy desert setting with lot of alien structures and cultures to discover n simple and short story that delivers its theme of finding purpose in freedom excellently n unique art style with little to no shading and shifting colors to make for constantly changing impressions n light environmental puzzles and decent collectibles strewn about just right to fill the map n well thought out movement mechanics in climbing gliding and driving that are built to fit the world and not the other way around as is often the case n overly restrained soundtrack with couple amazing songs being hidden in favor of unremarkable ambiance n clunky physics most noticeable on the essential bike n terrible performance as well as frequent glitches of all kinds

the persona series along with its parent series shin megami tensai have generally been consistent with their themes throughout the years the collective unconscious the masks that people wear to conceal their true selves and references to ancient greek and japanese mythology are all motifs that are usually present in smt and persona games this has led to consistently murky tone throughout the series in the undertones when not overtly while the darkest game in the series is up for debate there no debating which is the brightest persona 4 released just 2 years after the decidedly grim persona 3 and on the same engine p4 delivers an overall joyful and optimistic tone that helped it stand out not only from its predecessor but from previous persona and smt games as well this may seem counter intuitive as the focus of the story is on finding murder suspect who kills 2 people within hours of the game beginning yet it the moment to moment dialogue the soundtrack even the color palette the yellow theme provides an overall sunny disposition that makes persona 4 not only joyful experience but joy to experience

one of the first games that was given for my playstation 4 was physical copy of n infamous second son n but because my console disc drive got clogged up with dust at one point wasn able to play it or any other physical ps4 game for that matter for years now that finally got that fixed started playing through this game shortly after beating n grand theft auto vice city n and while wouldn consider this to be terrible game wouldn exactly say that liked it n infamous second son n is one of the most aggressively milquetoast games ve ever played as almost everything about it feels designed to be just competent enough to keep the player from switching the game off without actually being all that noteworthy the generic visual style and music really didn help with this as it just made the game generally feel much more bland and flavorless like lot of these kinds of games n infamous second son n focuses on the player having to fight yet another force of tyranny and every plot point and character relationship within that journey is as predictable as they can be none of the characters were very interesting but my least favorite was easily the protagonist because on top of the obviously bad idea of making him be part of fictional native american tribe delsin rowe was also just annoying as his constant quips and one liners consistently got on my nerves

dmc devil may cry é um jogo bem sólido com uma das melhores gameplays da série as melhores mais divertidas seções de plataforma gameplay é muito boa com muitos combos fluidos variedade da armas como parte fundamental dessa estrutura troca rápida de armas durante um combo porém mesmo sendo um game muito gostoso de jogar os inimigos não acompanham essa fluidez toda acabam sendo na esmagadora maioria do jogo apenas sacos de pancadas de combos que abaixa muito dificuldade do game que pode desagradar alguns incluindo eu no geral embora conte com um ou outro inimigo interessante no geral os inimigos não tem metade do carisma da série principal que tbm se reflete um pouco nos poucos chefes do game na qual dois em especial são bem criativos legais porém os outros não tem mesmo tempero que série clássica quanto história aoesar de um reboot dá pra perceber cuidado de contar uma história de início mais consistente uniforme diferente da série principal que é uma bagunça tremenda na questão do enredo cronologia história do jogo funciona passando um ar demoníaco mais sujo pé no chão do que padrão anime da série original que nesse jogo caiu muito bem porém acredito que maior responsável pelo rage que esse jogo sofreu seja seu protagonista dante que não tem 20 do carisma do protagonista original somada péssima estratégia de marketing usada na promoção desse jogo na época apenas reforçaram aversão ao personagem que infelizmente se refletiu na repercussão do game porém infelizmente fico curioso pra saber quais seriam os rumos da história partir desse game os quais eram promissores n no geral se você gosta do gênero hack slash deseja uma experiência extremamente gostosa de jogar você vai gostar de dmc devil may cry

a very fresh take on the series after gold cemented itself as the ultimate compilation the team found itself in need of new ideas think they did great job at it n the decision to make the characters control in such varied and unconventional ways is brilliant after all the series is at it best when the break neck excercise of going from minigame to minigame enters strange zen of decision making mixed with speed and rythm the charming characters adding deliciously to this recipe suddenly challenging minigame is matter of not only reacting and being familiar with it but of assesing how your character can approach the situation and how to use these tools for quick jolts of self expression and efficiency n while it hard to beat the party atmosphere of smooth moves the absolute banquette of content that is gold or the simple stroke of genius of the original this title prooves itself worthy of being up there in the pantheon of clever and elegant game design that is the wario ware series

the campaign is bit too short but very repayable as always n the multiple character mechanic completely freshens uo the formula n if you wanted game with more meat on its bones would still recommend gold over this one but not everyone has 3ds n that penny song is banger tho

tunic is wonderful 2d zelda like that feels like love letter to the genre between an extremely charming aesthetic fun and interesting items and being extremely packed with puzzles and mystery it would be hard not to recommend this game to any fan of the genre the inclusions of things like made up language and the instruction booklet all work to great effect to simulate that feeling you had when you were kid trying to play game like link awakening discovery is always well rewarded and always feel earned by the player feel as though there are very few handouts in terms of progression through the game so even just simply navigating the world feels meaningful and accomplishing level design is top notch in this game and love all the secrets and hidden paths they provide using the game isometric view think the weakest parts of this game compared to its contemporaries is the mood of the game

a really solid anthology of mini gold era square rpgs lost to time now easily accessible via this hd2d remake live live is must play for anyone who enjoys square super nintendo output or anyone who wants jrpg that doesn play by the book

this is collection of bunch of vignettes that all play with jrpg tropes in unique ways and for the most part found these stories really unique and entertaining this feels like the predecessor to chrono trigger in many ways so fans of that game will immediately see similarities it mostly very accessible game but my one big fault is that the game lets you choose any of these chapters to start with certain chapters enjoyed within the context of the rest of the game but are particularly unconventional and could make for very weak first impression aside from that tho honestly loved this combat is big standout for me each encounter was like mini tactics battle with really fun grid system had to thoughtfully consider how to dispatch enemies effectively and while it far from difficult game each battle had me engaged presentation is gorgeous with the hd 2d switch remake it a total overhaul that still remains faithful to the original while some chapters are definitely weaker than others thoroughly enjoyed the majority of my time with this game and while won spoil the final segments that come after you finish the seven main chapters found them to be so fun and satisfying that they elevate the entire experience this definitely deserves to be considered classic of the era right alongside ffvi and chrono trigger

i really enjoyed this one the story is super interesting most characters are multi layered and more complex than they initially seem and how this game handles skills and thoughts is genius as most reviews for this game have said it really great that failing skill check does not necessarily mean you re now going through worse version of the game in some cases it even more fun route the politics and wordbuilding are also super deep and will really please those who enjoy those topics in their media personally found myself more engrossed by the game study of the main character who was as awful and destructive as he was likeable and relatable also found it incredible how the writers have managed to give him his own personality while also allowing huge amount of his character to be determined by the player normally games tend to present one of these two archetypes for their main character but this mixture of both helps lot in giving the player much deeper connection with the character while also allowing the character to serve the main themes of the story n on that note the amount of choices they give you for customizing him are insane and they really don feel overwhelming despite there being multiple methods to change your character once again this contributes heavily into making the player fit into the role playing aspect of this game more as their choices contribute to the type of cop they want to be

a plague tale é uma aventura sobre dois irmãos durante período da peste jogo segue base do estilo narrativo com uma gameplay simples porém funcional dando foco principalmente em sua história comentando brevemente sobre jogabilidade plague tale não possui mecânicas refinadas ou grandes listas de habilidades diversas jogo resolve usar uma abordagem mais simples com apenas uma arma alguns tipos de munições que em suma maioria é utilizada de maneira pontual ao decorrer da jogatina gameplay simples relativamente repetitiva não é um problema aqui visto que jogo possui um enredo rico em detalhes que consegue desenvolver sua premissa com perfeição em um misto de momentos de ação angústia nervosismo fúria obra consegue entregar aquilo que promete muito mais conseguindo explicar os pontos que foram propostos serem explicados ao mesmo tempo que deixa pontas soltas para sua sequência plague tale requiem

in this first game the story and switching between present day circa 2007 and the past set in the crusade era holy land is such an intriguing premise and the authenticity of the world and character design can be admired that isn to say the game is the worst thing ever but it truly is soooooooo tedious and repetitive that it tough to recommend the parkour system is very cool and has lot of attention to detail put into the running and climbing animations scaling towers and doing leaps of faiths is so fun which somewhat makes up for the overabundance of sync points there are many other menial side missions that while not lacking in variety are just copy and pasted everywhere and it gets tiring very quickly play it if you re curious as some of the stealth is fun and little more low key compared to later entires in the series but don be surprised if it gets dull very quickly

ghost trick é facilmente um dos melhores jogos de ds não bastando sua gameplay única diversificada com touch cada puzzle é único sua narrativa contextualiza de forma genial suas ghost tricks seu cast principal é perfeito não só tem uma construção boa pro seu propósito como transmitem vida com ajuda das animações fabulosas até mesmo extravagantes que tornam satisfatório cada momento que você não está no controle ouso dizer ainda que ign está errada linearidade da obra torna crível funcional no meio de tudo que engloba não é um defeito n trilha sonora arrebenta composições extremamente boas para seus momentos efeitos sonoros de alta qualidade n texto é muito bom sabendo que nenhuma explicação seria boa suficiente foca na sua temática de morte arrependimento destino causa consequência ao invés de se demorar com origem do seu poder ainda sim sua explicação é aceitável se torna um bom recurso de roteiro até que se prove contrário é passível de não ter furos de roteiro ou pontas soltas sendo gratificante cada mistério resolvido inserido construção para grand finale não poderia ser melhor

citizen sleeper n has dense sometimes even suffocating atmosphere one full of textures the sleeper synthetic skin the ink black color and consistency of space sensations the cold floor and the annoying flickering of the lights colors in the outlandish outfits of the characters smells and tastes the spiciness and rich flavour of emphir fungus sounds the mechanical whirring and the bleep bloop
satisfying and hopeful lovely

a rare game that seamlessly melds the core game mechanic into rich world built on layers of narrative and some killer art and sound spend 5 minutes on n the eye n and it ll feel like you ve lived your whole sleeper life there spend 1 hour on n the eye n and for all it rusted containers failing life support and crushing spiraling n existence n you ll want to call it home

with art by guillaume singelin and music and sound design by amos roddy gareth damian martin n citizen sleeper n is genuinely gorgeous and rich game that gently reminds you that staying still is not always the best option even if you manage to pull yourself or get pulled into better place it also gently compels you to think about those moments in your life where sacrifices or compromises had to be made and how the choice to make them wasn always voluntary n nor was it always yours to make in the first place

i feel the mechanical nakedness of this game is both blessing and curse at first was worried that it would hurt immersion but the great characters and fantastic ambience music design dragged me fully in after the first 20 or so minutes even found that the nakedness of the system made you really feel what your impact in the world is and really highlighted the sense of player agency which is plentiful in this game

i find myself in the odd position of struggling to write about n deus ex n the game felt longer than it actually was engrossing in way haven really experienced d consider myself good fan of immersive sims and it isn hard to see why this is considered as essential as it is n n deus ex n is by far the most accessible of its peers where games like n system shock 2 n or n vampire the masquerade bloodlines n had great diversity in buildcrafting and emergent gameplay there was always an almost cruel sense that there was specific comically unspecified character that large chunk of the games were designed for perhaps the absence of this ill balancing alone is what made n deus ex n more popular than its contemporaries but such an assessment perhaps fails to do justice to the feats of design that elevates it so much higher n n deus ex n doesn have even close to the same sense of aesthetics of other role playing games of its era rather unremarkable soundtrack with no astounding moments of art direction to really speak of there is great detail in its real estate but other than that one could not find the common constituents of game atmosphere to draw in through naturalistic ways so why then is n deus ex n so deeply immersive dynamism never before has world felt as reactive as this there is only one true instance where the world is not completely open ended to you where the game of the year version has made progressing to the level 2 labs of versalife impossible to do before returning to tong other than that every area puts the ball in your court if you can dream up solution chances are it can be done npcs objectives access to areas all remains seamless and alters accordingly pick up key before talking to an npc who tells you to go get it its not just that denton will be quick to mention this its the fact that you could potentially just walk past the npc entirely and get the move on there no disconnect in decision making you ll feel connected to denton the way you should playing game like this

here a pressing question for all you gamers under the age of thirty do you actively avoid playing games from the pre 3d era because of their lack of availability or because their foundation is comparatively primitive and therefore jarringly inaccessible the reason can be because these games are locked in an archival vault for they are commonly ported to modern platforms it must be due to the prevailing notion that video games have an arbitrary expiration date mon fess up m not saying everyone born after the early 90s shares these predilections but there seems to be widespread viewpoint among younger gamers that vilifies games that predate their own conception especially those of the early pixelated 2d period released before the late 1990s sneering distaste for the classics isn as pervasive with films or music zoomers will attend theater screenings of 2001 space odyssey high as kite and emphatically detail their transcendental experience to their peers with pulp fiction poster in the background of their dorm rooms no one is delusional enough to place the prequels or disney star wars films over the immortal original trilogy regardless of their age maybe it because spend too much time on the internet but ve noticed that discovering older music artists via the world wide web is more common practice among teenagers now than it was when was in high school older video games on the other hand are treated with the same reaction of revulsion as if they were being forced to eat their brussels sprouts admittedly as someone born in the early 3d era many of the industry practices and comparatively primitive facets of game design can verge on being excruciating can count merely handful of games that were released before was born that are among my personal favorites as there is only so much pain can handle before my spirit shatters and am in dire need of relaxing bath with some chocolate ice cream for comfort conversely there are plenty of those whose gaming prime was this jagged era and the shift to 3d left them bewildered they ve assigned themselves to the role of gaming elder statesmen whose repertoire is cryogenically frozen to the time before the medium became polygonal after certain point where the gaming industry reached point of proficiency with 3d visuals to an almost cinematic extent games that resembled those of the primeval pixelated years started popping out of the indie woodwork one of the first breakout titles in this new wave of old school revival games was shovel knight 2d side scroller that arguably bridged the generational gap of gamers

yume nikki is one of those games often point to in conversation with fellow designers as shining example of how well video game can capture specific person experience these types of rpg maker horror games usually get bad rap they are often cheap products made by inexperienced designers who believe that mashing teenage girl protagonists with horrific set pieces will instantly make work profound yume nikki does not deserve to be lumped in with the contemporaries kikiyama the developer managed to extract clever narrative meaning within the bounds of rpg maker limited toolset in way that left me genuinely floored this game is best approached completely blind so will refrain from saying any details but it has transformed the way approach experiential design even if the games want to make look nothing like this

max payne is such good game with some crippling problems that really date it the voice acting is top tier and james mccaffrey is the biggest reason for this success and is one of the best voice actors ever the gameplay is unqiue and so satisfying diving through the air as the world explodes around you and bullets whiz past you the depiction of new york as this grim snowy crime ridden land fits so well with the place and the cheesiness makes this so good but played this on the pc port and the game crippling issues with the difficulty slider got annoying really quick walking through door and getting insta headshot three times and then the fourth time doing the same thing and not having it happen got annoying and supposedly there is major bug that makes it so the difficulty slider which is tied to the only difficulty you can play at the start is broken and doesn properly balance the game as well some aspects feel little too gamey in this serious tale with few levels sticking out like sore thumb the underground level feel enemy variety wasn really thing just the same enemy that got stronger and stronger but overall this is very good game with aspects that haven ever really been replicated as well which is shame we need more top tier slow mo shooters

a sinopse que fala que é dos mesmos criadores de amnesia passa mensagem errada sobre jogo por mais que ainda seja um jogo de horror ele não tem mais nenhum elemento de survival seu foco é em sua história jogo não tem jumpscares ou coisa do tipo é extremamente atmosférico é nela na historia que você desvenda ao longo do jogo que está verdadeiro horror do jogo em questão de gameplay jogo é dividido entre seções onde você resolve puzzles que geralmente não são tão complicados também algumas seções em que você tem encontro com inimigos deve tentar utilizar as mecânicas do jogo para avançar jogo não tem combate ou você se esconde ou você corre se você gosta de um jogo com uma história bem feita ou com uma atmosfera bem imersiva recomendo em questão de jogo de sustinho pode ser que não seja jogo ideal pra você

a southern gothic science fiction adventure game taking place as the protagonist kay returns to her hometown in post civil war us amid worldwide catastrophes in order to find her brother after your mothers death from cancer new orleans is an industrial dystopia overseen by the shield chemical corporation stand in for shell oil that is in the real life area and as you explore more you learn about mysterious client your mother was working for and the different people that had taken an interest in her the lead occasionally shifts to the recent past where you play as kay mother norco has little focus on traditional adventure puzzle solving where you mostly find and combine items and instead will often give you multiple ways to handle problem minor turn based qte and memory based combat text adventure scenes driving boat in swamp set in an alligator hand puppet poetry while disco elysium and kentucky route zero dabbled in some similar themes and dealt with stranger and magical elements of an otherwise often serious and more realistic setting norco goes further into the strange and leaves with much less concretely answered

dói me muito falar mal desse jogo até porque gostei dele no geral é um jogo tão diferente do que estamos acostumados um realismo fantástico bem pessoal com arte impecável n talvez meu maior problema com norco seja exatamente este ele é pessoal demais lendo declarações do criador vi que ele mora na cidade que inspirou norco vivia perto de uma usina de extração de óleo da shell local onde chegou ter explosão ele falava de como cresceu vendo aquele dragão de fogo saindo da chaminé sinto que ele não conseguiu passar isso tão bem com jogo é algo pessoal demais tem seu valor por isso mas ainda assim comunicação não foi tão eficaz n ademais ter escutado antes de jogar que se tratava de um jogo de esquerda termo meio bobo fez eu ver quão batida era essa tecla eu até ria de como em todo lugar tinha alguém falando mal de uma empresa de aplicativo sendo explorado por esquemas sofrendo com poluição empresarial sei que isso acontece na vida real mas como é um jogo point click colocar npcs para falarem essas coisas deixa narrativa viciada repetitiva

action games generally operate on the concept of player empowerment granting the tools to overcome any challenge without scratch as long as players have the skill to realize that potential meanwhile horror games operate on the concept of player n disempowerment n giving the bare minimum in order to foster tense atmosphere so balancing the priorities of each genre seems like mixing oil and water resident evil games are famous for trying to do so but they usually break into horror centric first half and an action centric back half without true blending of the concepts the evil within meanwhile actually managed it but had to alienate players in some key ways in order to do so firstly the logic behind the story is nearly impossible to follow at first leaving players unable to find their footing confused at why the progression is so jumpy and unfocused then the mechanical restrictions feel like they re equally arbitrary sebastian can only initially carry about twelve bullets and not even full healthbar worth of recovery he can barely run at all and in order to alleviate any of this you may have to bank up green gel over the course of multiple chapters it can seem like the game is simply trying to make action feel scary by stressing out players with cheap deaths but once you commit to learning the game brilliant method behind the madness reveals itself while the story n is n mostly nonsense the abstract nature of it allows for level design suited to wide variety of challenges with new mechanics being introduced at steady pace players are constantly kept on the backfoot and thus disempowered even as their growing mechanical knowledge empowers them the shallow capacity for supplies is an obvious form of disempowerment which prompts players to spend resources cleverly but their abundance between each fight empowers players to use their entire toolkit freely the upgrade system empowers the below par baselines make unupgraded stats more of problem in the face of scaling challenge for every give there a take and thus harmony between action and horror is reached as stated before though the take for that brilliance is frontloaded sense of disempowerment with players having to get through most of the game before they ve experienced enough character growth and skill development to redress the balance so really can blame anyone for bouncing off of this game but also truly believe that as of today less than week away from re4 remake it the best merging of action and horror in gaming resident evil 4 is pure satisfying action dead space commits to bloody horror but the evil within is purely both

imagine que aconteceria se você misturasse temática visual sanguinolência de doom com as clássicas mecânicas de jogos rítmicos baseadas em apertar botões no tempo certo bom essa mistura existe se chama metal hellsinger se você já jogou doom alguma vez na sua vida provavelmente já reparou que um dos pontos fortes da saga são suas trilhas sonoras marcantes que conseguem tornar experiência de cortar demônios ainda mais prazerosa n pensando nisso desenvolvedora the outsiders resolveu criar sua própria versão do clássico de 1993 porém com adição de uma mecânica um pouco diferente ritmo gameplay de metal hellsinger se baseia em realizar as ações tradicionais de um jogo de tiro atirar pular esquivar recarregar porém tudo sincronizado com música n no centro da tela ao lado da mira do jogador existe um marcador com bpm da música objetivo é realizar as ações do jogo dentro do tempo quanto mais preciso você atira mais dano pontos você faz uma das partes que eu mais achei interessante no jogo é seu objetivo aqui seu objetivo não é só completar fase mas também fazer maior pontuação possível n ao todo jogo possui 10 capítulos cada capítulo termina com uma boss fight ao completá lo outros 3 desafios são liberados no mesmo cenário em questão de tempo de gameplay jogo é relativamente curto podendo ser fechado em cerca de 5 horas porém esse tempo pode se estender caso você esteja em busca do 100 n história do jogo é simples porém suficiente para um bom plano de fundo de um tiroteio infernal você joga como desconhecida metade humana metade demônio desconhecida parte através do inferno para recuperar sua voz que foi roubada pela juíza vermelha em sua jornada você deve destruir hordas de demônios seus líderes para enfim travar um combate com juíza recuperar voz que lhe foi roubada n mas vamos falar do que interessa trilha sonora música é ponto alto do jogo como é de se esperar ela é impecavel jogo conta com 15 músicas autorais escritas compostas exclusivamente para título melhor parte é que cada música conta com participação especial de grandes nomes do metal internacional entre os artistas convidados estão alissa white gluz arch enemy mikael stanne dark tranquility tatiana shmayluk jinjer serj tankian system of down além de outros grandes nomes totalizando 9 artistas convidados n as músicas são muito boas qualquer um terá uma experiência agradável jogando porém é claro elas se tornam muito mais prazerosas para aqueles que não só já gostam do gênero mas também para aqueles que já escutavam os artistas convidados previamente n os pontos altos do jogo obviamente são focados na música no gameplay trilha sonora acompanha perfeitamente tiroteio frenético da jornada através do inferno a experiência se torna mais prazerosa com sistema de ritmo fazendo com que você tenha que acertar tiros esquivas recargas no tempo da música também é bom citar como ponto positivo fato dele estar disponível gratuitamente no xbox game pass n não tem muitos pontos negativos no jogo mas se for pra citar algum talvez seja interessante citar tempo de gameplay que em uma zerada apenas pode ser muito curto não compensar os 99 reais investidos claro esse tempo pode aumentar caso você jogue em uma dificuldade mais elevada ou caso você deseje fazer 100 do jogo

the persona series along with its parent series shin megami tensai have generally been consistent with their themes throughout the years the collective unconscious the masks that people wear to conceal their true selves and references to ancient greek and japanese mythology are all motifs that are usually present in smt and persona games this has led to consistently murky tone throughout the series in the undertones when not overtly while the darkest game in the series is up for debate there no debating which is the brightest persona 4 released just 2 years after the decidedly grim persona 3 and on the same engine p4 delivers an overall joyful and optimistic tone that helped it stand out not only from its predecessor but from previous persona and smt games as well this may seem counter intuitive as the focus of the story is on finding murder suspect who kills 2 people within hours of the game beginning yet it the moment to moment dialogue the soundtrack even the color palette the yellow theme provides an overall sunny disposition that makes persona 4 not only joyful experience but joy to experience

one of the first games that was given for my playstation 4 was physical copy of n infamous second son n but because my console disc drive got clogged up with dust at one point wasn able to play it or any other physical ps4 game for that matter for years now that finally got that fixed started playing through this game shortly after beating n grand theft auto vice city n and while wouldn consider this to be terrible game wouldn exactly say that liked it n infamous second son n is one of the most aggressively milquetoast games ve ever played as almost everything about it feels designed to be just competent enough to keep the player from switching the game off without actually being all that noteworthy the generic visual style and music really didn help with this as it just made the game generally feel much more bland and flavorless like lot of these kinds of games n infamous second son n focuses on the player having to fight yet another force of tyranny and every plot point and character relationship within that journey is as predictable as they can be none of the characters were very interesting but my least favorite was easily the protagonist because on top of the obviously bad idea of making him be part of fictional native american tribe delsin rowe was also just annoying as his constant quips and one liners consistently got on my nerves

i was worried that the retirement of nathan would leave uncharted without anything to carry story as never considered chloe very interesting character in 2 thankfully lost legacy compensates nicely with shorter story that doesn ask too much of the player while still hitting all the correct beats the gameplay improvements made in 4 make triumphant return though the climbing is still annoying each big set piece is dynamic and exciting the game never lingers too long or moves on too quickly on the open zone section in the beginning have conflicted feelings on one hand the dialouge between chloe and nadine is charming and entertaining without feeling too artificial and enjoyed the scenery however this series has always been about maintaining momentum now have newfound appreciation for the sublime pacing of the older games after experiencing what it feels like to lose that forward moving feeling the game definietly picks up the tempo again afterwards but can say the section left good impression overall the rest of the game is exactly as one would expect the villain is nothing special the platforming is cool and rhytmic but not very complex and there aren really any themes to delve into beyond the absolute minimum stuff don mind though am satisfied with the game being nice adventure to relax with role it easily fulfills

man like wanted to like this just as much as 1 and 2 but there are crapton of bad level design and enemy placement choices making this ultimately the most inferior out of the classic trilogy levels are cramped and theres lot of times where you will get ambush sniped by an offscreen zombie hiding behind corner or just zombies in one person wide corridors where you better hope you have the ammo to take them out otherwise you aren getting through nemesis is cool though like the funny zombie guy wish he showed up more frequently and stalked you all throughout the map but the times he does show up can be exciting and the man runs at you like football player which is awesome all in all the game is definitely memorable and worth checking out if you like resident evil stuff but it is definitely the most flawed and occasionally frustrating game of the classic style so beware
